    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Creates the board

        Uses StringBuilder objects to store the parts of the board. Puts the StringBuilders in appropriately in the ArrayList rep to make a graphical representation of the board.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update​(Player p,
                   char column,
                   int row)
        Updates the board image

        Checks if the player exists, if so stores the color and and players color marker, else stores the empty space. Sets the location on the board with the player's marker of where their piece should be.

        Parameters:
        p - A player
        column - Column indicator
        row - Row indicator

      • removePiece

        public void removePiece​(char column,
                        int row)
        Removes a piece from the board

        Calls update() where the player is set to null. This enables the square to be reset to its unowned state

        Parameters:
        column - Column indicator
        row - Row indicator

      • isRossette

        public static boolean isRossette​(char column,
                                 int row)
        Checks if requested space is a rossette
        Parameters:
        column - Column indicator
        row - Row indicator
        Returns:
        boolean True if space is a rossette, false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a graphical representation of the board
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String Graphical representation of the board
